issue.title: cmake with gui fails on macos 15.5 unless qt@5 is the only installed version
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Current behaviour

when qt@5 is installed along side default brew qt or qt@6 the cmake system will break and deployed application will not build.

In the build requirements qt@6 is mentioned however the app will not build on this version of qt

### Expected behaviour

I expected the compiler to use qt@6 as that is what is listed in the build requirement docs.

### Steps to reproduce

build the app on macos 15.5 with any version of qt greater than qt@5 or when qt@5 is installed alongside any newer version of QT

### Relevant log output

-- Could NOT find Qt5 (missing: Qt5_DIR)
CMake Error at /opt/homebrew/share/cmake/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:227 (message):
  Could NOT find Qt (missing: Qt5_DIR) (Required is at least version
  "5.11.3")
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /opt/homebrew/share/cmake/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:591 (_FPHSA_FAILURE_MESSAGE)
  cmake/module/FindQt.cmake:59 (find_package_handle_standard_args)
  CMakeLists.txt:179 (find_package)

### How did you obtain Bitcoin Core

Compiled from source

### What version of Bitcoin Core are you using?

v29.0

### Operating system and version

MacOS 15.5

### Machine specifications

M2 pro Macbook pro
